name: ARREGLO DEL CAMPO PARA ABRIRSE
texString: %%UNOTAS: NO EL EXCEDENTE CORTO A  1. BLOQUEO 2X  SIMPSON CS16X48" LARGO CON  2. - - - - - 3. - 4. NINGUN CORTE O AGUJEROS EN  5.  EN PARED DEL ESQUILEO LOS CLAVOS EN 2-1/16" EN CENTRO  LOCALIZACION ALTERNA DE LA ABERTURA SI PLACA CONTINUA  DEL TRAVESANO, NINGUNA CORREA  DEL "CS" REQUERIDA EN LA PARTE  INFERIOR. EL ENTABLADO DENTRO DE 16"  DE ESQUINAS.  ABERTURAS DEL MAXIMO 3X3. NO  NECESITA EL BLOQUEO/CORREA.  NO CORTE MAS DE UNO QUE SE  ABRE EN UNA LINEA HORIZONTAL  (EN UNA ELEVACION) Y ABERTURAS  COMPENSADAS POR EL MIN.  4" VERTICAL. EVITE DE ABRIR EN PAREDES DEL  ESQUILEO CON LONGITUD MENOS  DE 4'-0"  MAX. ANCHURA DE ABRIRSE A SER UNA BAHIA O 16" DEL PERNO PRISIONERO. NINGUN MIEMBRO QUE ENMARCA.  CLAVO DEL BORDE AL BLOQUEO  A LA PARED DEL ESQUILEO DEL  FOSFORO. CLAVO DEL BORDE A  MENOS QUE LA CORREA SE  COLOQUE ENCIMA DEL CHAPEADO. ALTURA COMPLETA DEL CLAVO DEL  BORDE A LO LARGO DEL PERNO  PRISIONERO EN CADA LADO  DE LA ABERTURA. SI LA ABERTURA SE LOCALIZA EN  EL BORDE, EXTIENDA LA CORREA EN LA PARED DEL ESQUILEO PARA RESOLVER EL MIN. LONGITUD  REQUERIDA. R

EDGE DISTANCE AS REQUIRED BY THE MANUF. SPEC. BOTH STUDS. %%UHDU %%UHTT5 6. EXTERIOR FOOTING EDGE. REBAR PER TABLE, CENTERED @ "HD" 1. 3. SIMPSON PAB STD. STEEL BOLTS PER 2. (BEND REBAR @ CORNER). FOR COND. B, LOCATE TOP REBAR 3" TO 5" FROM TOP OF CONCRETE. 5. DOUBLE HEX NUTS WITH WASHER. SEE SCHEDULE FOR SIZES. SCHED. (ALL THREAD A307-C/A36 RODS CAN BE USED IN LIEU OF PAB BOLTS). - %%UPLAN VIEW %%USSTB @ CONC. CORNER %%UPLAN VIEW %%USSTB @ CONC. END 5" MIN 5" MIN. 4. SSTB BOLTS PER SCHEDULE. 16" RETURN FOR 5/8"%%C BOLT) ENTIRE EMBED. LENGTH. CONCRETE STEM/FOOTING MIN. SEE 11. USE 16d SINKER NAILS. (0.148"x3 1/4") FOR HTT4 & HTT5. WIDEN FTG. WHERE OCCURS, SEE DETAIL #1. 9. 20 5/8" FOR SSTB24, 24 7/8" (MIN.) FOR SSTB28. 10. CONCRETE END. 8. FOR INSTALLATION INFORMATION NOT SHOWN. - REFER TO MANUFACTURER SPECIFICATIONS  1/4"%%Cx4 1/2" SDS SCREWS SHOULD BE USED. - WHEN 3-2X MEMBER IS USED FOR HDQ8 & HDU, TRANSFER PLATE FOR HDU11, HDU14, HHDQ11, & - HEAVY HEX ANCHOR NUT IS REQUIRED ON LOAD HHDQ14  HOLDOWNS. CLR. 7. CONCRETE CORNER. 12. FTG WIDTH (13" FOR 7/8"%%C BOLT, 9" FOR 5/8"%%C BOLT). 13. EDGE OF DEEPENED SLAB/FTG FOR HOLDOWN @ INT. SHEAR WALL. BOTTOM OF SLAB. TOP OF DEEPENED EXT. FTG FOR PAB BOLT INSTALLATION. BOTTOM OF EXT. FOOTING/ MAT. 14. WIDTH (8" MIN. FOR 7/8"%%C BOLT, 6" MIN. - SEE DETAIL #1  FOR LEGEND & INFO NOT SHOWN.  - SEE PLANS FOR HOLDOWN TYPES. %%UNOTES: - FOR MISSING OR MISLOCATED HOLDOWN, SEE DETAIL 18/SN-3. %%U@ SW @ EXT. FOOTING %%U@ SW @ EXT. FOOTING 15. 16. EDGE OF EXTENDED/ENLARGED EXTERIOR FOOTING. 17. FOR ANCHOR BOLT LOCATED LESS THAN 1.5 le    FROM 18. CONC CORNER/END, EXTEND THE FTG AS FOLLOWS: CORNER COND. - THE REMAINING BALANCE OF 1.5 le   , (16" MAX.), INTO THE RETURN FOOTING.  B B %%USSTB BOLTS INSTALLATION %%UPAB BOLT INSTALLATION CLR. %%U@ SW @ INT. FTG/SLAB %%U@ SW @ INT. FTG/SLAB MIN. CLR. MIN. E E C C F F %%USECTION E-E B %%USECTION F-F B D D %%USECTION D-D %%USECTION C-C MIN., TYP. %%UCOND. %%UCOND. %%UCOND. %%UCOND. & S.W. EDGE NAILS STAGGERED ON SCHEDULE - FOR HD12 AND HD19, USE 6X6 POST MIN. MIN., TYP. END. COND. - FOR SSTB LOCATED AT LESS THAN CONCRETE FOOTING END PER PLAN. B 1.5 le    FROM CONC FOOTING END, THE EXTENDED FOOTING PER SEC. E-E & SEC. F-F, ENDS AT WHERE CONT. FOOTING REINFORCEMENT CAN BE COUNTED AS PART OF REBAR REQUIREMENT  IF BAR SIZE ARE SAME AS THOSE REQUIRED PER SCHEDULE; OTHERWISE, BARS PER * SCHEDULE ARE ADDITIONAL. SIMPSON HOLDOWN HDU8 PAB BOLTS HDU11 HHDQ11 HDQ8   HTT5 F (MIN) (COND. A) 18" CENTERED #4 BAR x 8'-0" @ HD (2) TOP & (2) BOT. SEE SECT. E-E * PAB5 PAB8 SIZES (3) TOP & (3) BOT. (4) TOP & (4) BOT. N.A. CENTERED #5 BAR x 8'-0" @ HD * IN LIEU OF #4 USE (1) TOP & (1) BOT. (2) TOP & (2) BOT. FTG EXTENSION SSTB BOLTS NOT APPLICABLE PAB7 SSTB BOLTS (COND. B) SSTB24 SIZES SSTB28 SSTB28 & SECT. F-F (2) TOP & (2) BOT. le A 12" HD19 HD12 HDU14 HHDQ14 21" PAB9 24" PAB10 16" (3) TOP & (3) BOT. 3/8"x1 1/2"x1 1/2"16"10"1/2"x3"x3"3/8"x2 1/4"x2 1/4"3/8"x2 1/2"x2 1/2"3/8"x2 3/4"x2 3/4"SIZE PL. WASHER 6 1/2"10 1/2"14" R

CORNER %%UPLAN VIEW %%USSTB @ CONC. END 5" MIN 5" MIN. 16" RETURN MIN. %%UPAB BOLT INSTALLATION %%USSTB BOLT INSTALLATION %%U@ SW @ INT. FTG/SLAB %%U@ SW @ INT. FTG/SLAB CLR. MIN. D D %%USECTION C-C %%USECTION D-D F F %%USECTION F-F %%USECTION E-E & S.W. EDGE NAILS STAGGERED ON B CLR. %%USSTB BOLTS INSTALLATION %%U@ SW @ EXT. FOOTING E E 1.5 le B 1.5 le B B 1.5 le B 1.5 le B %%UPAB BOLT INSTALLATION SEE PLAN IF  LARGER PAD IS REQUIRED A MIN., TYP. C C %%U@ SW @ EXT. FOOTING A SEE SCHEDULE %%UHDQ8 %%UHDU %%UHTT5 6. EXTERIOR FOOTING EDGE. REBAR PER TABLE, CENTERED @ "HD" 1. 3. SIMPSON PAB STD. STEEL BOLTS PER 2. (BEND REBAR @ CORNER). FOR COND. B, LOCATE TOP REBAR 3" TO 5" FROM TOP OF CONCRETE. 5. DOUBLE HEX NUTS WITH WASHER. SEE SCHEDULE FOR SIZES. SCHED. (ALL THREAD A307-C/A36 RODS CAN BE USED IN LIEU OF PAB BOLTS). 4. SSTB BOLTS PER SCHEDULE. FOR 5/8"%%C BOLT) ENTIRE EMBED. LENGTH. CONCRETE STEM/FOOTING 11. USE 16d SINKER NAILS. (0.148"x3 1/4") FOR HTT4 & HTT5. WIDEN FTG. WHERE OCCURS, SEE DETAIL #1. 9. 20 5/8" FOR SSTB24, 24 7/8" (MIN.) FOR SSTB28. 10. CONCRETE END. 8. FOR INSTALLATION INFORMATION NOT SHOWN. - REFER TO MANUFACTURER SPECIFICATIONS  1/4"%%Cx4 1/2" SDS SCREWS SHOULD BE USED. - WHEN 3-2X MEMBER IS USED FOR HDQ8 & HDU, TRANSFER PLATE FOR HDU11, HDU14, HHDQ11, & - HEAVY HEX ANCHOR NUT IS REQUIRED ON LOAD HHDQ14  HOLDOWNS. 7. CONCRETE CORNER. 12. FTG WIDTH (13" FOR 7/8"%%C BOLT, 9" FOR 5/8"%%C BOLT). 13. EDGE OF DEEPENED SLAB/FTG FOR HOLDOWN @ INT. SHEAR WALL. BOTTOM OF SLAB. TOP OF DEEPENED EXT. FTG FOR PAB BOLT INSTALLATION. BOTTOM OF EXT. FOOTING/ MAT. 14. WIDTH (8" MIN. FOR 7/8"%%C BOLT, 6" MIN. - SEE DETAIL #1  FOR LEGEND & INFO NOT SHOWN.  - SEE PLANS FOR HOLDOWN TYPES. %%UNOTES: - FOR MISSING OR MISLOCATED HOLDOWN, SEE DETAIL 18/SN-3. 15. 16. EDGE OF EXTENDED/ENLARGED EXTERIOR FOOTING. 17. FOR ANCHOR BOLT LOCATED LESS THAN 1.5 le    FROM 18. CONC CORNER/END, EXTEND THE FTG AS FOLLOWS: CORNER COND. - THE REMAINING BALANCE OF 1.5 le   , (16" MAX.), INTO THE RETURN FOOTING.  B CONCRETE FOOTING END. B - FOR HD12 AND HD19, USE 6X6 POST MIN. MIN., TYP. END. COND. - FOR SSTB LOCATED AT LESS THAN CONCRETE FOOTING END PER PLAN. B 1.5 le    FROM CONC FOOTING END, THE EXTENDED FOOTING PER SEC. E-E & SEC. F-F, ENDS AT WHERE CONT. FOOTING REINFORCEMENT CAN BE COUNTED AS PART OF REBAR REQUIREMENT  IF BAR SIZE ARE SAME AS THOSE REQUIRED PER SCHEDULE; OTHERWISE, BARS PER * SCHEDULE ARE ADDITIONAL. SIMPSON HOLDOWN HDU8 PAB BOLTS HDU11 HHDQ11 HDQ8   HTT5 F (MIN) (COND. A) CENTERED #4 BAR x 8'-0" @ HD (2) TOP & (2) BOT. SEE SECT. E-E * PAB5 PAB8 SIZES (3) TOP & (3) BOT. (4) TOP & (4) BOT. N.A. CENTERED #5 BAR x 8'-0" @ HD * IN LIEU OF #4 USE (1) TOP & (1) BOT. (2) TOP & (2) BOT. FTG EXTENSION SSTB BOLTS NOT APPLICABLE PAB7 SSTB BOLTS (COND. B) SSTB24 SIZES SSTB28 SSTB28 & SECT. F-F (2) TOP & (2) BOT. le A 11" HD19 HD12 HDU14 HHDQ14 19" PAB9 22" PAB10 (3) TOP & (3) BOT. 1/2"x1 3/4"x1 3/4"1/2"x2 1/2"x2 1/2"5/8"x2 3/4"x2 3/4"SIZE PL. WASHER 13 1/2"9" 12 1/2"14 1/2"3/4"x3 1/2"x3 1/2"5/8"x3 1/4"x3 1/4"16 1/2"9"6"R

UTILISEZ  LES DOIGTS DESSUS ET BAS A 8" OU A GALETTE PLUS EPAISSE.  COLOQUE LOS PASADORES  APROXIMADAMENTE 1-3/4" DE LA TAPA DE LA LOSA. LA ANCHURA DE LA ABERTURA DEBE  SER MINIMA. 20" TENER EN CUENTA  ENCLAVIJAR COMO SE MUESTRA. - MARQUE LA RUTA DEL TENDON EN AMBAS DIRECCIONES EN SUPERFICIE  DE LA LOSA EN LA VECINDAD DE ABRIRSE PROPUESTO ANTES DE PROCEDER CON LA EXCAVACION DE LA LOSA. - DE-TENSION TODOS LOS TENDONES  QUE PASAN CON EL AREA QUE ES  CORTADA. SI CORTA ENTRE LOS  TENDONES, NINGUNA NECESIDAD  DE-TENSION CABLEGRAFIA, PERO  CORTO DEBE SER 6" LEJOS DEL CABLE. - EL CUIDADO EXTREMO SERA  TOMADO PARA NO DANAR NINGUN  TENDON DURANTE LA REPARACION. - VIERTA LOS TENDONES CONCRETOS  NUEVOS DE 4000 PSI NO SERA RE- STRESSED HASTA NUEVOS ALCANCES  CONCRETOS 3000 PSI (EN CASO DE  QUE LOS TENDONES ERAN DE-TENSIONED). - LA INSPECCION ESPECIAL SE  REQUIERE DURANTE PROCESO DE LA  CONSTRUCCION. DE LA TENSION DEL POSTE R

DETAIL SHEET NUMBER DROP IN SLAB (VERIFY PRIOR TO CONSTRUCTION) SYMBOLS LEGEND P3 P7 P6 P5 P4 P2 P1 DETAIL NUMBER PX PAD NUMBER REBAR FOOTING SYMBOLS LEGEND DROP IN SLAB (VERIFY PRIOR TO CONSTRUCTION) DETAIL SHEET NUMBER DETAIL NUMBER PX REBAR PAD NUMBER FOOTING ALL SITE PREPARATIONS SUCH AS GRADING AND COMPACTION OF THE FILL SHALL BE PERFORMED UNDER  A SOILS ENGINEERS RECOMMENDATION AS INCLUDED IN THE SOLS REPORT CONTRACT DOCUMENTS FOR THE FOUNDATIONS SHALL BE REVIEWED BY A SOILS ENGINEER PRIOR TO THE START OF CONSTRUCTION.ALL FOOTING EXCAVATIONS AND DRILLED FILE HOLES SHALL BE INSPECTED AND CERTIFIED IN COMPLIANCE WITH THE SOILS REPORT BY A SOILS ENGINEER PRIOR TO THE PLACING OF CONCRETE OR  STEEL.3. ALL EXCAVATIONS FOR FOOTINGS SHALL HAVE FIRM LEVEL BOTTOM IN MATERIAL SOILS OR APPROVED COMPACTED FILL.  EXCAVATIONS SHALL BE KEPT FREE OF STANDING WATER WHERE EXCAVATIONS HAVE BEEN MADE TO A DEPTH GREATER THAN INDICATED, SUCH ADDITIONAL DEPTH SHALL BE FILLED WITH CONCRETE AS SPECIFIED FOR THE FOOTINGS.4. CAISSONS, CAISSONS SHOULD BE DRILLED, INSPECTED, CERTIFIED AND FILLED WITH CONCRETE WITHIN THE SAME WORKING WEEK.  THE CAISSON SHAFT SHALL NOT BE KEPT OPEN OVERNIGHT.  ALL SHEARING CRIBBING AND CASING SHALL BE CLEAN AND FREE OF LOOSE MATERIALS OR WATER WHEN CONCRETER IS PLACED.  ALL CAISSONS DRILLING SHALL BE IN THE PRESENCE OF THE SOILS ENGINEER, WHO WILL INSPECT AND CERTIFY THE 
SHAFT PRIOR TO PLACING ANY CONCRETE.5. CONCRETE, CEMENT SHALL CONFORM WITH ASTM 150.  WATER SHALL BE CLEAN, FRESH AND SUITABLE FOR  DOMESTIC USE.  THE CONCRETE MUST ACHIEVE A MINIMUM STRENGTH OF 2500 PSI IN 28 DAYS.  CONCRETE SHALL BE MACHINE MIXED.6. REINFORCEMENT: STEEL BARS SHALL CONFORM TO ASTM A16 AND BE GRADE 40 OR 60.  WIRE FABRIC SHALL CONFORM TO ASTM 185.  THIS WIRE SHALL BE 16 GAUGE, BLACK ANNEALED CONFORMING TO ASTM A-82.7. HARDWARE: ANCHOR BOLTS SHALL BE MANUFACTURED OF ASTM SA-307 STEEL.8. NO PIPES OR CONDUITS SHALL EXTEND UNDER ISOLATED COLUMN FOOTING OR UNDER CONTINUOUS WALL FOOTING UNLESS SPECIFICALLY DETAILED OR APPROVED BY THE ENGINEER OR BUILDING OFFICIAL.9. BACK FILL SHALL NOT BE PLACED UNTIL SUPPORTING FOUNDATIONS, WALLS AND SLABS HAVE ATTAINED SUFFICIENT STRENGTH TO SUPPORT LATERAL SOIL PRESSURE.10. REINFORCING STEEL BARS IN THE PIERS SHOULD BE STRUCK INTO THE HOLE BOTTOMS BEFORE FILLING WITH CONCRETE TO ASSURE THAT THE REINFORCING REMAINS PROPERLY SPACED DURING THE POURING OF CONCRETE.  THE BARS SHOULD THEN BE PULLED UP TO PROVIDE PROPER CLEARANCE AFTER THE HOLES ARE POURED BUT BEFORE THE CONCRETE SETS.11. TO PREVENT THE WET CONCRETE FROM SETTING, THE PIER HOLES SHOULD NOT CONTAIN MORE THAN THREE INCHES OF SLOUGH.  IT MAY BE NECESSARY TO TAMP THE SLOUGH PRIOR TO CONCRETE PLACEMENT, AS DETERMINED BY THE SOILS ENGINEER.12. THE UPPER SIX INCHES OF SOIL BENEATH THE GRADE BEAMS SHALL BE LOOSENED AND THOROUGHLY SATURATED BEFORE THE BEAMS ARE CAST.  THE CONTRACTOR SHALL NOT ALLOW SLOUGHING-OUT OF CONCRETE BENEATH GRADE BEAMS FORMS OR MUSHROOMING AT THE TOPS OF PIERS.  ANY SUCH WIDENING OF PIERS OR GRADE BEAMS SHOULD BE TRIMMED AWAY BEFORE CONCRETE FULLY SETS.13. ALL FOUNDATION DETAILS TO BE VERIFIED BY THE SOILS ENGINEER.14. THE SOIL ENGINEER SHOULD REVIEW THE FINAL GRADING AND FOUNDATION PLANS FOR CONFORMANCE WITH THE INTENT OF THEIR RECOMMENDATIONS.15. LOCATIONS OF ALL CAISSONS IS AS SHOWN ON THE PLAN AND SHOULD NOT CHANGE WITHOUT CONSULTING WITH GOUVIS ENGINEERING.16. INSTALL 20 GA GALVANIZED METAL FLASHING BETWEEN ALL UNTREATED LUMBER IN CONTACT WITH CONCRETE OR  MASONRY.17. ALL ANCHOR BOLTS (AB) SHALL BE 5/8" DIAMETER X 12" WITH 2' HOOK EMBEDDED 7" MINIMUM AT 72" ON CENTER MAXIMUM UNLESS NOTED OTHERWISE.18. ALL PIER, CAISSONS ARE 16" X 8' DEEP WITH (2) #7 VERTICAL BARS, FULL DEPTH, UNLESS NOTED OTHERWISE.19. TYPICAL GRADE BEAM IS 8' WIDE X 18" DEEP CONCRETE BEAM WITH
(2) #4 BAR AT TOP CONTINUOUS
(2) #4 BAR AT BOTTOM CONTINUOUS
(2) #4 BARS AT TOP TO BE TIED BACK 18" MINIMUM INTO GRADE BEAM, (1) EACH WAY, AND 18"   
MINIMUM INTO CAISSONS.

WAITING PERIOD FOR CONCRETE SLABS-ON-GRADE PRIOR TO START OF CONSTRUCTION IS AS FOLLOWS:
a) WALK ON SLAB 24 HOURS AFTER CONCRETE HAS BEEN POURED.
b) BEGIN WALL FRAMING 4-5 DAYS AFTER CONCRETE POUR.
c) BEGIN ROOF/FLOOR FRAMING 7-10 DAYS AFTER CONCRETE POUR.
d) DO NOT LOAD ROOF PRIOR TO 14 DAYS AFTER CONCRETE POUR.22. REFER TO TABLE BELOW FOR ANCHOR BOLT SIZES AND SPACING.3.
